Describe all items of one specific layer. More...

List of all members.

Highlighted items

Types, members and methods used when drawing the highlighted items on the map.
  • void drawHighlightedItems ()
    Highlight the items on the map that should be highlighted.
  • vector< highlightitem_t > m_highlightedItems
    A vector with the items to highlight.

Highlighted coordinates

Types, members and methods used when highlighting selected coordinates on the map.
  • void drawHighlightedCoordinates ()
    Highlight the coordinates on the map that should be highlighted.
  • vector< highlightcoord_t > m_highlightedCoordinates
    A vector with the coordinates to highlight.

mc2-coordinates -> screen coordinates.

Members and methods that are used to convert from true coordinates (lat,lon) to screen-coordinates.
  • gint16 getGtkX (int32 lon)
    Get the x-value from a given longitude on the current map.
  • gint16 getGtkY (int32 lat)
    Get the y-value from a given latitude on the current map.
  • float64 m_latScaleFactor
    The factor that is multiplied with the latitude.
  • float64 m_lonScaleFactor
    The factor that is multiplied with the longitude.
  • float64 m_latSubFactor
    The factor that is substracted from the latitude.
  • float64 m_lonSubFactor
    The factor that is substracted from the longitude.
  • uint8 m_filterLevel

Create a new layer with items.

void MEItemLayer::createItems (  const OldGenericMap *  map,
MC2BoundingBox &  bboxLatLon,
gint16  hPixels,
gint16  vPixels
) 
 

Create the items for this layer from the given map, over the given area.

Parameters:
map The map where to get the items from.
bboxLatLon The latitude and longitude that describes the bounding box that will be shown.
hPixels The number of horizontal pixels that will be shown on the screen.
vPixels The number of vertical pixels that will be shown on the screen.

virtual void MEItemLayer::drawItems (   )  [virtual]
 

Draw the items in this layer.

Reimplemented in MEStreetSegmentItemLayer.

bool MEItemLayer::drawItemWithID (  uint32  id,
Glib::RefPtr< Gdk::GC > &  gc,
bool  highlightNode = false,
bool  locate = false
)  [protected]
 

Draw one item with given ID on one given GC.

Is also useable when highlighting one of the node if the item is a street segment item. In this case, the id will be used to get the node to highlight (the MSB is set if node 1, unset if node 0).

Parameters:
id The ID of the item to draw on the screen (in window m_window).
gc The graphics context that should be used when drawing the item.
highlightNode True if to highlight the node described by the MSB in id, false otherwise.
locateItem True if the item should be located (draw a big square around it), false otherwise.

Member Data Documentation

multimap<uint32, MEDrawableItem*> MEItemLayer::m_allItems [protected]
 

All the drawables in this layer that should be displayed at the current zoom-level.

Have the ID of the items as key, and a pointer to a MEDrawableItem as value.
